name: Villablanca Garden Beach Hotel

reviews.text: When we arrived at Villablanca we were told that the hotel was overbooked and they couldn't give us our requested room.... so they gave us the Penthouse at no extra cost! The room was spacious with a huge bed and had several balconies looking out to the ocean and the gardens. The pool and gardens are very nice and it's located right across the street from the beach just south of town. It's a 30 minute -or-so walk into town. From villablanca we went into town and also to Chankanaab Park for snorkeling. I spent hours snorkeling on the beach just across from the hotel. Great little hotel, good value, and a nice location.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed at VB for a week, July 28 through Aug 5 2008. Bought a package through Papa Hogs. I upgraded to the superior room as I wasn't sure if there would be two or three people at the time of booking. I live in mainland Mexico for two months during the year and the States for the rest so I know what to expect, and love, when booking in Mexico. Check in was fast. People at the desk had little personality and DIDN'T SPEAK SPANISH! which was a bit suprising but we got the upstairs room as I had requested. When moving luggage to our room the bell boy gently removed a snake that was sleeping on the cart that was to hold our luggage. The room was large and had a limited view of the ocean. It was clean, well equipped and more than I had anticipated. There is high speed wireless internet that works when it feels like it. Papa Hogs let us use theirs since we were staying with them and could easily pick up the signal from our room. The hotel has limited services like room service. It is available during hours that you really don't need it and they charge 15% more than if you went to the restaurant to get it yourself. Room was clean, no bugs (amazing for Mexico), with full size fridge to keep things in so there will be no bugs. Iguanas outside to enjoy from the beautiful gardens, dive hooks outside the room to dry your equipment, phone, and air conditioning that worked minimally (remember it's August) so I had to leave it on (which I don't like to do) during the day in order to have the room cool enough to sleep in at night. The hotel is set back enough from the street so that you don't get TOO much noise except from the bar across the street and that wasn't nightly. It was a bit far from town $5 taxi each way every time you want to eat. We ate mostly at the bar next to Papa Hogs (they serve PH's food) as it was convenient. The restaurant at VB is outstanding. Only ate there at night, I think the other restaurant serves during the day. Nothing interesting on the menu. There is a minimart (similar to a 7 11) just steps away so you can purchase most snacks if you get the munchies.
reviews.title: Great place, good price

reviews.text: I think the VB is exceptional for the price. After reading about other hotels that had "smells" and "loud noise" all night I think we'll stay with VB for our next trip too. THEY DO NOT ACCEPT CREDIT CARDS, so be prepared to pay cash for everything. No problem as that is common in Mexico but uncommon for a hotel. When in Mexico you should expect to see iguanas, spiders, geckos, etc. It's part of Mexico. They should be outside the rooms, not inside.
reviews.title: Great Budget Hotel !

reviews.text: Traveled as a single mom with my 16 yr. old son. Was given room S-20 upstairs with a balcony with a view of the ocean. Room and bathroom was very big and clean. We had a fridg. and cold AC. Hot water took awhile to come, just run the water for a few minutes. We had a great time in Cozumel and glad I stayed in a non-all inclusive hotel for the first time. Felt pretty safe, but being on the top floor helped I'm sure.

reviews.text: We stayed in a superior room S13, on the second floor for one week. It had king bed and single bed/sofa, tv, phone, small fridge, I always had a warm shower, they supply soap and shampoo, but I always bring my own.
The room was clean and spacious for the 3 (women) of us and so was the outside areas and grounds.

Villablanca was just enough for us
reviews.text: The balcony is very tiny, room for only two plastic patio chairs, you have a view of the ocean from it. The gardens are beautiful and well taken care of. The pool is not heated. The hot tub was warm. The restaurant was open, we never eat there, choosing to go out and discover different fare. The staff all seem to be friendly and polite except when we checked in at 11 pm at night, our Sunwing flight was 5 hours late. The guy at the front desk started to argue with me and said I should contact my booking agent..... not something you want to hear after arriving late, tired and pissed off at the airline.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Two of us went and had a fine time at the Villablanca. The staff were friendly and brought plenty of bottled water to the room whenever we asked for it. The hotel restaurant has very good food. We liked the hotel because we were traveling on a shoestring budget and used it as a base for exploring the island on our rented scooter. Plenty of snorkeling right off the beach across the street from the hotel, but it's worth taking the short drive south to the park where the fish are eager to swim with the visitors. It's a great budget hotel, so don't go expecting five star amenities. The iguanas loved to watch the sunset with us. We stayed in B-8 in the back on the second floor and had a fine time.
reviews.title: Had a great stay

likes.liked: — Wi-fi in the lobby and some rooms (close to the lobby)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've stayed at the VIllablanca several times over the past few years, and are very happy with it. In fact, I just made a reservation for another week there. The rooms are clean, big and quiet, snorkeling off the beach is good, the staff has always been helpful and friendly. We feel it's an excellent value and a good location, although a bit removed from downtown. It is not a luxury hotel, but is comfortable.
reviews.title: And we're going back again

reviews.text: Are these people that are praising this resort talking about the same resort I stayed in... The Villablanca???? I only stayed there one night (thank god) because I was booked for a week at a different resort on a Friday to Friday stay and could only get a flight in on the day before. I thought this resort looked ok for one night after looking at it on the web. I felt like I was in a shady border town in Mexico instead of on Cozumel island. The pictures on the web are nothing like the resort. The resort seems to be very old. Our bedding had holes and stains on them. The bed was hard as a rock. When I turned on the water to take a shower, all I got was a gurgling sound and a trickle of water. I called the front desk and they were not concerned. They said try again later. They do not have a water purification system so don't drink it!!! Their supply of drinking water was a 5 gallon jug with a hand pump stuck in it. The air conditioning was a window unit stuck about 8 foot in the air and all this was in a "deluxe" unit. I would hate to see the standard unit!!! I can't give reviews for the staff or food because I left there asap the next day.
reviews.title: Terrible!!!!

description: Villablanca Garden Beach is a beachfront hotel located approximately 5 miles from Cozumel Airport and two miles from town, right in front of Villablanca Reef and Wall (great for snorkeling and diving).Our exclusive property includes 50 rooms and suites, two villas and a Pent-House, all units are equipped with A/C, ceiling fan, refrigerator, satellite TV, telephone and sunken tubs.
